text: The Kolobok
Once upon a time, in a little village,  there lived a kind grandpa and grandma.
One day, Grandma said, "I'm going  to bake a kolobok cake."
"Mmm, sounds delicious!" said Grandpa.
After she baked the cake, she put it on the windowsill to cool.
Then ...
Twitch went the cake.
Blink went its eyes.
Hee, hee, heel it laughed. "Hi, I'm Kolobokl"
Grandma and Grandpa looked at Kolobok.
Kolobok looked at them.

"I want to play!" cried Kolobok, and then rolled out the window, 
down the road and into the woods.
"Our kolobok is alive!'' cried Grandpa.
"We have to find it!" cried Grandma.
They chased after Kolobok.
In the woods, Kolobok rolled into a rabbit.
"Hi, I'm KoIobok!"
"Well, hello, Kolobok," said Rabbit, licking her lips.
"I bet you taste so sweet."
"Wait!" cried Kolobok.
"Don't you want to hear my song before you eat me?"
"Make it quick," said Rabbit.
"I was made just today, and all I want to do is play.
What'll I do to escape from you?
I'll jump right up and roll away!"
And Kolobok quickly rolled away.
Grandma and Grandpa chased after Kolobok.
Deeper in the woods, Kolobok rolled into a bear.
"Hi, I'm KoIobok!"
"Well, hello, Kolobok," said Bear, raising his claws.
"I bet you taste yummy."
"Wait!" cried Kolobok.
"Don't you want to hear my song before you eat me?"
"Make it quick," said Bear.
'I was made just today, and all I want to do is play.
What 'II I do to escape from you?
I'll jump right up and roll away!"
And Kolobok quickly rolled away.
Grandma and Grandpa chased after Kolobok.
Finally, Kolobok rolled into a fox.
"Hi, I'm Kolobok!"
"Well, hello, Kolobok," said the sly Fox.
"I bet you taste delicious."
"Wait!" cried Kolobok.
"Don't you want to hear my song before you eat me?"
"What?" said Fox.
"I can't hear you.
Come and sit on my nose."
Kolobok bounced up onto Fox's nose.
"I was made just today, and all I want to do is play.
What'll I do to escape from you?
I'll jump right up and roll ... aaah!"
Fox opened her mouth and Kolobok fell in!
"Stop!" Grandpa cried.
And before Fox could close her mouth, Grandpa jumped on her and squashed her flat!
Kolobok flew out of Fox's mouth and up into the air.
"Whee!" cried Kolobok, and landed in Grandma's arms.
"Now you're safe, my sweet Kolobok," she said.
Then they went home together, and lived happily ever after.
